Gagan turned entrepreneur in 2004 and joined Vyaktitva as a partner with the desire to help enhance people’s performance across organizations. Gagan has been working on various Coaching, Organizational Design, and Learning & Development assignments focussed on enhancing individual and organizational performance. He has designed and delivered solutions for premier organizations including the Max group, PepsiCo, Amex, Unilever, Colgate, Airtel, Genpact, Tata AIA, Hewitt, Whirlpool, Accenture, Interglobe group, GE, ITC, Hero, RB, Mother Dairy, Ericsson, Cap Gemini, Jubilant, Viacom18, Aditya Birla Group, Godrej, CK Birla Group, Star India, CapitaLand, and IBM. His experience has been across countries, cultures, levels, and industries.

He has also done extensive work with owner/ proprietor/ family-run businesses, partnerships, and volunteers regularly for social sector organizations. In addition, Gagan is currently focusing on areas such as wellness, yoga, holistic living, meditation, mindfulness, and helping develop conscious leaders and organizations.

cards.title: Hema Annamalai
cards.designation: Co-Founder and Vice Chair, Green Collar Agritech Solutions Pvt Ltd.

children.value:
Hema is the Co-Founder and Vice Chairman of Green Collar Agritech Solutions Pvt Ltd, a company that enhances the livelihood of Small and Marginal Farmers (SMF). Green Collar makes customised quality grading systems for all the stakeholders of the agri value chain, by harnessing powerful technologies of AI/ML in crop production and post harvest processing solutions.

Hema was the founder and former CEO of Ampere Vehicles, an early mover that spearheaded India’s E-Vehicles revolution. Ampere has carved a niche for itself as an innovative technology creator in the Indian Electric Vehicle Industry, contributing to environmental sustainability. Ampere has been acquired and Hema has fully exited the venture.

A serial entrepreneur, Hema has spent the last 25 years creating and driving varied entrepreneurial ventures spanning Professional Services, Electronics, Skill Development and Automobiles.

Hema strongly promotes Job Creation and focusses on Women empowerment. She also invests and mentors Innovative disruptive startups from smaller cities that solves societal problems.

Hema is the past chair of TiE ( The Indus Entrepreneurs) Women program, a global initiative of TiE that embrace, engage and empower Women. She was the Former President of TiE Coimbatore. Hema is also the Founder of Uni Connect Pte Ltd, Singapore.

Hema is the Founding Patron of Society for Smart E-Mobility (SSEM), Coimbatore.

Hema holds an MBA from Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology, Australia and a Bachelors degree in Computer Science and Engineering from Government College of Technology, Coimbatore.

cards.title: Himanshu Saxena
cards.designation: Founder & CEO, Centre of Strategic Mindset (COSM)

children.value:
Himanshu is the Founder & CEO of Centre of Strategic Mindset (COSM). His mission is to groom strategic minds who can deliver bold business impact. He is a strategist, design thinker and a mindfulness practitioner. He features among world’s Top 100 Executive Coaches in Leadership, Strategy & Culture. He has coached 54 CEOs & 616 Senior Leaders, globally. He has personally impacted the growth of 25000 leaders. In 2022, he was ranked 62nd among world’s Top 200 Voices in Leadership and Top 20 Mentors in the world. In the year 2021, He featured among Top 100 Thought Leaders to inspire. He is currently mentoring many entrepreneurs. Prior to COSM, he has had six careers in his life, starting as an erstwhile Geologist, serving in Indian Military (Retd Colonel), has been an UN Observer in Africa, been an entrepreneur before heading Strategy & Leadership Development at TCS.

He considers himself a STUDENT OF LIFE & A TEACHER OF EXPERIENCE.

cards.title: Megha Tata
cards.designation: Chief Executive Officer, Cosmos Maya India Private Limited

children.value: Megha Tata joined Cosmos Maya as Chief Executive Officer on 3rd October 2022 where she will oversee the firm’s operation and lead the animation studio into its next phase of growth. Megha has held leadership roles at organizations such as WB Discovery, BTVI, HBO, Turner International and Star TV. In an illustrious career spanning over 3 decades, Megha has had a consistent record of increasing sales, effective negotiation, profit and loss analysis and strategic implementation of business operations. Ability to overcome obstacles and capture opportunities by closing exclusive deals, create and implement savvy marketing strategies has been her forte. An industry veteran, she leads multiple national as well as international industry forums and an esteemed member of the National Media and Entertainment Committee of FICCI. Megha has been on the board of IBF (Indian Broadcasting Federation). She served as the Vice President of the International Advertising Association (IAA) India Chapter from 2016-2018 and as President of IAA – India Chapter (2020-2022). The second woman to hold that position. Currently she is the Immediate Past President of IAA. Megha has been instrumental in launching several marquee projects in the Indian broadcast space. She has been bestowed with multiple industry accolades during her career. Megha is recognized amongst the top 50 influential women in media, marketing and advertising and was also conferred ‘Women of the decade in media’ by the Women Economic Forum in 2018.She was also adjudged amongst Asia’s Most Inspirational Women in Leadership for 2022 by House of Rose Professional. In addition to being actively involved in industry initiatives, Megha is energized by engaging with young minds through guest lectures at leading educational institutes including IIT, IIM, ISB, UBS, and is passionately involved as a Volunteer with Isha Foundation – a non-profit organization started by Sadhguru.

cards.title: Moumita Sen Sarma
cards.designation: Isha Leadership Academy

children.value: Moumita Sen Sarma is the Director of Isha Leadership Academy, an initiative of Isha Foundation. A Chartered Accountant by training, Ms. Sen Sarma has served the Financial Services sector for 23 years in several capacities, prior to joining Isha Foundation as a full time volunteer in 2010. Till March 2010, she served as the VP and Head of Microfinance and Sustainable Development at ABN AMRO Bank, India. In 2003 she set up the Bank’s Microfinance business and was also the Founding Board Member of the ABN AMRO Foundation India, (later renamed RBS Foundation India). Led by her team’s work, the Bank won many awards and recognition in the area of Sustainability, including the Global IFC / FT Sustainable Banking Award in the Emerging Markets category in 2007. Her team also produced a Sustainability Report of the Indian Operations of ABN AMRO, a first of its kind for the Financial Services Sector in India which won the Global GRI’s Reader’s choice Award. Ms. Sen Sarma has served as a Board Member of Cashpor Micro Credit since 2003. She has also served as a Board Member of Oxfam India (2008 to 2014), Ananya Finance for Inclusive Growth (2010 to 2014), ABN AMRO Foundation (2006 to 2010) and as a Stakeholder Council Member of Global Reporting Initiative (GRI), Netherlands until 2012. She has been a frequent speaker at conferences on both Microfinance and Sustainable Development in India and abroad (incl USA, EU: World Bank/IFC, Tallberg Forum, WEC, Ethical Corporation, Women’s World Banking, Euro Market Forum, Sa-Dhan, WRI) as well as Business Schools in India (IIM Ahmedabad, ISB Hyderabad, S.P Jain Mumbai). Ms Sen Sarma joined ABN AMRO Bank in the year 1998 and prior to setting up the Bank’s Microfinance business in India, worked within the Bank with several responsibilities ranging from Risk Management (wholesale credit) to lending (large Corporate clients). Prior to joining ABN AMRO, Ms Sen Sarma worked with American Express Bank for 3 years (1996-1998) managing corporate relationships; prior to that she was looking after the leasing and hire-purchase business of SRF Finance (later acquired by GE Capital) for 3 years (1993-1996). She also spent a year in consultancy with Price Waterhouse Coopers (1993). Ms Sen Sarma trained at Price Waterhouse Coopers for her CA and is a Graduate in Physics from the Presidency College, Chennai, India.

cards.title: Mythily Ramesh
cards.designation: Co-Founder and CEO, NextWealth

children.value: Mythily has more than 30 years of experience in her career. She completed her BE Computer Science from College of Engineering, Guindy and MBA from IIM Ahmedabad. In her 20 year successful stint in Wipro she grew from a Customer support executive to a Senior Vice President. Her career spans product management, marketing, Business Head and Quality. As a certified Black Belt she drove the Six Sigma initiative in Wipro and was successful in moving the organization from 1.7 Sigma to 4.7 Sigma and reducing the order to collection cycle from 365 days + to 120 days. With a passion for entrepreneurship, she was the CEO of a start up in Wipro called 01markets and built a successful business around e-procurement and was a pioneer in Reverse Auctions in India. She is a certified CPM and CPIM specialist. She then moved to the Corporate office to handle Mergers & Acquisitions, Business Development and Innovation. As part of Innovation she seeded multiple new service areas which have grown into 100+ million dollar business for Wipro. In her last stint in Wipro as Senior VP for Wipro BPO, she was responsible for pre-sales and solutioning, product management, transition, platform BPO, BPO Consulting and procurement BPO operations. Her target was to build the business revenue – increase the back-office business from 5% to 35 % which she did in three years timeframe and also brought in 300 million dollars of business for the division. In 2006 and 2007 she was adjudged one of the 25 most Powerful women in India by India Today and Dataquest. In February,2023 she was given the ET-Ascent Business leader of the Year award. She has also been the recipient of the Distinguished Alumni award by College of Engineering Guindy during their 225 years anniversary celebration. In 2010 she and a few ex-Wipro colleagues started a social entrepreneurship firm NextWealth focusing on AI/ML data services, back office and IT services from small towns in a unique distributed delivery model. Their mission is to create 10000 jobs in the small towns. She is currently the Co-Founder and CEO of NextWealth. She serves on the board of Karnataka Bank and is the Chairperson of their IT and Digital committee, and is a member of the Nomination and compensation committee. She is also a Director on the subsidiary of Karnataka bank KBL Services Ltd. She is a member of the Board of Governors of Indian Institute of Management, Udaipur. She is a member of the Nasscom BPM Council and heads a Task Force focusing on moving the IT/BPO industry to set up delivery centres in small towns. She retired as an Independent Director from WEP solutions Ltd and WEP Digital after serving on the board for eight years. She served as a member and as an office bearer of the Steering committee of IIMPACT for eight years, an NGO started by IIMA Alumni focusing on educating the underprivileged girl child in India. She is married with two boys and pursues painting, music and yoga in her free time.

cards.title: Shankar Jagannathan
cards.designation: Author; Founder & Former Chief Executive, Cimplyfive Corporate Secretarial Services Pvt Ltd

children.value: A passionate student of Corporate Governance & Sustainability, with three decades plus of experience in Corporate, Start-up, Academics and Social Sector across organisations like Wipro, Azim Premji Foundation, Oxfam India, Indian Institute of Science, Dept Of Management Studies and CimplyFive. Author of two books Corporate Disclosures 1553-2007, The Origin of Business & Financial Reports published by Rutledge and The Wisdom of Ants, A Short History of Economics published by Westland. Prior to April 2023, was the Founder & Chief Executive of CimplyFive Corporate Secretarial Services, the pioneer and leader in Corporate Secretarial automation solution, offering BLISS a SaaS based software, which is now part of Cleartax after it was acquired by them in June 2022. Currently on the boards of a few companies as a non-executive directors and consulting for select companies, Shankar is a Chartered Accountant and a law graduate.

cards.title: Sangeeta Prasad
cards.designation: Group CEO, Runwal Developers Limited; Former MD & CEO, Mahindra Lifespace Developers Limited

children.value: Sangeeta is a driven and passionate leader with 30 years of experience and pedigree to manage large businesses through a strategic mindset with operational and execution excellence. She is currently the Group CEO for Runwal, a leading and premier real estate developer in Western India. She believes in creating and enhancing organization and business value and motivate diverse set of people towards a common goal. Her conviction of purpose, tenacity and persistence drives her to do meaningful, value-oriented work. Her experience spans across multiple lines of business, across various functions and roles, handling both mature and startup businesses.

cards.title: Sanjay Rastogi
cards.designation: Head, Corporate HR, Trent Limited

children.value: Sanjay Rastogi is the Head of New Businesses, Strategy, ESG & Leadership for Trent Limited. Prior to his current role he was Head of HR. Sanjay has expertise in successfully integrating long term business strategy, converting opportunity business. Sanja’s orientation and deep expertise of curating people strategy, building customer & employee centric organization with agile culture earned him his current job.Sanjay has recently moved in to his new role wherein he is responsible of incubating new business for Trent in the area of premium fashion space, taking existing businesses to international markets and making Trent operations environmentally sustainable.. Education & Expertise- After completing his Bachelor’s degree in Science from Meerut University, Sanjay went on to complete a course in Computer Application before pursuing his Master’s degree in Business Administration from Mumbai University. Sanjay was part of the healthcare; pharmaceutical sector (Wockhardt Limited) for 13 years prior to joining Trent Limited in 2006. Sanjay’s interest also lies in helping government and non-government bodies in overcoming challenges of employability and education. He loves spending time and coaching students and business start-ups.

cards.title: Nina Chatrath
cards.designation: Leadership and Business Consultant; Independent Board Director, Oriental Hotels, Dwarikesh Sugars & Vision Springs

children.value:
Nina has spent the last two decades guiding businesses to excellence, through quality and leadership initiatives, as she donned the hat of a trusted advisor to organizations. Her key focus area has been to unlock organizational capabilities using business and behavioral interventions. She focuses on building the strategic momentum of the business by working with the top leaders, which is at the heart of what value an HR leader can bring to the organization.

CEO Development and Succession Planning is a delivery expectation from Boards, as also having a robust process to review CEO’s performance in a way that enhances their leadership and company’s performance. As she works towards unlocking the potential of key leaders through coaching, she witnesses the effect it has on the individual performance leading to organizational excellence.
Here is what you can look forward to during this immersive
3-day program:
Includes stay in the powerfully energized and natural environs of the Isha Yoga Center, and nutritious vegetarian meals.
15% discount per person, plus taxes
For CEOs & CHROs from the same organization, 12% discount per person, plus taxes.
For 4 or more participants from the same organization, 15% discount per person, plus taxes.
12% discount per person, plus taxes.

sectionContent.text: *Please note that these offers cannot be combined.

children.value: More than 200 CEOs, CxOs, and entrepreneurs experientially imbibed the DNA of Success from three iconic business leaders and Sadhguru. Participants also received mentoring from 25 Resource Leaders. Here are some glimpses from Isha INSIGHT 2022.

video.title: Do You Really Trust Your Employees?
How to Manage People without Managers
A Use and Throw Policy is a Poor HR Strategy
Can Organization Design Be Changed Frequently

children.value: info@ishafoundation.org

faqs.question: What is the “Human Is NOT a Resource” program?

children.value: The “Human Is NOT a Resource” program is a transformative initiative by the Isha Leadership Academy, aimed at offering practical steps to enable a paradigm shift to viewing human beings as Possibilities instead of mere resources. It challenges conventional notions and seeks to empower individuals by nurturing their unique qualities and potentials.

faqs.question: Who is this program designed for?

children.value: The “Human Is NOT a Resource” program is designed for CxOs, business leaders, executives, HR professionals, and individuals seeking a new perspective on managing human-related situations and challenges in the workplace. It is ideal for those who believe in harnessing human creativity and potential for organizational growth.

faqs.question: Can I attend this program if I am not from a business background?

children.value: Absolutely, the program is open to individuals from various backgrounds, including business, arts, academia, and more. It offers insights applicable to diverse sectors and anyone interested in holistic approaches to human development.

faqs.question: Will Sadhguru be part of this program?

children.value: While Sadhguru may not be physically present, the program draws inspiration from his insights and wisdom. It offers a unique perspective on human potential and nurturing individual growth, and exclusive sessions tailored by Sadhguru that are only available in this program.

faqs.question: What are the key themes covered in the “Human Is NOT a Resource” program?

children.value: The program explores themes such as fostering creativity, nurturing individual talents, promoting a positive work culture, and embracing a holistic approach to human development

faqs.question: How long is the “Human Is NOT a Resource” program?

children.value: The program is typically conducted over a span of two and a half days. It is designed to provide an immersive and transformative experience for participants.

faqs.question: What is the last date to avail the Early Bird offer?

children.value: The Early Bird offer is available for limited seats only and is therefore subject to availability.

faqs.question: Can two discount offers be clubbed together?

children.value: No, two discount offers cannot be clubbed.

faqs.question: Is financial assistance available for this program?

children.value: At present, there is no financial assistance available for the “Human Is NOT a Resource” program.

faqs.question: How can I pay?

children.value: You can pay online using a debit card/credit card. Alternately, Indian participants can also pay through NEFT/RTGS bank transfer while overseas participants can pay through Wire Transfer.

faqs.question: Is accommodation provided during the program?

children.value: Yes, accommodation is provided at the Isha Yoga Center on an individual-occupancy basis as part of the program. The Isha Yoga Center offers comfortable and clean residential facilities to ensure a conducive environment for learning and inner exploration.

faqs.question: Will the accommodation be on a shared basis?

children.value: The accommodation will be provided on an individual-occupancy basis.

faqs.question: Who is a Resource Leader? Can I ask questions to the Resource Leader?

children.value: Resource Leaders are highly experienced individuals from diverse industries who offer valuable insights and guidance during the Insight program. Throughout the program, a Resource Leader will be assigned to your table, allowing you the chance for one-on-one interactions. They will guide you through sessions and various workshop-style activities, allowing you to ask questions and seek their expertise.  Recent Resource Leaders have included notable professionals such as Amit Anchal (Chief of Group Strategy & Corporate Finance at
OLA
OLA
Electric) and Gajendra Chandel (Former President, Tata Motors).

faqs.question: Who is a Speaker? Can I ask questions to the Speaker?

children.value: A Speaker is an experienced individual with expertise in a specific field, sharing insights on topics such as organizational culture, talent nurturing and more. They provide valuable learning to participants. For example, in HINAR 2023, Anuradha Razdan, CHRO, Unilever, South Asia, spoke about how Unilevers' successful endeavors in diversifying their organizational culture has resulted in the organization producing remarkable business leaders every year. Participants have the opportunity to ask questions to the Speaker during a Q&A session following their presentation.

faqs.question: Is this program affiliated with any specific belief system or religion?

children.value: No, the 'Human Is NOT a Resource' program is designed to be inclusive and does not align with any particular belief system or religion. It focuses on universal principles of human potential and growth.

faqs.question: Can I attend the program more than once?

children.value: Yes, participants are welcome to attend the “Human Is NOT a Resource” program multiple times. Each iteration offers the opportunity for deeper exploration and learning.

faqs.question: What language are the program sessions conducted in?

children.value: The program is conducted in English.

faqs.question: Is the program certified or accredited?

children.value: The “Human Is NOT a Resource” program is a unique offering by Isha Leadership Academy (Isha Education) and is not certified or accredited by external institutions. Upon completion, you will receive a certificate of participation.

faqs.question: What is the process to cancel or transfer my registration?

children.value: Refund, Cancellation, and Substitution Policy :
Substitution of your registration with another participant is permitted without additional charges.
Your request for cancellation / substitution should be sent in writing to leadership@ishainsight.org and is subject to approval.
Cancellation requests made 28 days prior to the program will result in a refund of 90% of the program fees you have paid.
Cancellation requests received between 28 to 22 days (including the 28th and 22nd day) prior to the program will result in a refund of 50% of the program fees.
No refunds will be provided for cancellation requests received within 21 days of the program’s start date (including the 21st day).
Please ensure the accuracy of the invoice details before submitting the form, since they will be used to generate the invoice. Once generated, the invoice cannot be altered.

allIlaLandingPages.summary: Explore practical strategies to nurture talent, cultivate a culture of innovation and agility, and create sustained growth in an increasingly competitive and borderless world. Receive tools to transform yourself as you transform your organization.

children.value: A rare opportunity to imbibe the essence of successfully scaling up businesses from industry stalwarts.

cards.title: Anuradha Razdan
cards.designation: Executive Director HR, Hindustan Unilever; CHRO, Unilever South Asia

children.value:
Anuradha is a business focused HR leader with an international career. She currently serves as a member of the Management Committee of HUL as Executive Director HR and Chief Human Resources Officer, Unilever South Asia. She is also a member of the Unilever Global HR Leadership Team. Anuradha joined HUL as a Management Trainee in 1999 and spent the first 14 years of her career building diverse experiences in India after which she was seconded to Unilever’s headquarters in London for 6 years.

Whilst in London, Anuradha worked first as Executive Assistant to the former CHRO, and then as VP HR for the Home Care Division globally partnering members of the Unilever Executive. She has deep M&A experience and has also led the Talent Attraction agenda for Unilever globally, raising the company’s attractiveness to an all time high.

In her current role as CHRO, Anuradha is driving an ambitious and future focused People agenda, to build Talent and Capabilities for Unilever South Asia to win in the next decade. She is passionate about leadership development and is a strong voice advocating for more inclusive businesses and communities.

She is the Co-Chair of the FICCI Human Resources Committee and the Co-Convenor of the G20 EMPOWER Working Group on Corporate Women Empowerment.

cards.title: Amit Kalra
cards.designation: Chief Transformation Officer, HLE Glascoat Limited

children.value: Prior to his recent role as the Chief Transformation Officer, HLE Glascoat; Advisory Board Member, THALETEC GmbH; Chief Transformation Officer, Yashasvi Rasayan Private Limited; Amit was the Member of the Executive Management Team at Hilti Manufacturing India, which is a subsidiary of the Europe-based multinational Hilti Group. With close to two decades of exhaustive experience, Amit has worked across some of the world’s large engineering and technology companies, including Hilti, Umicore and Infineon, and has held leadership positions internationally. Amit is passionate about organizational development and his life purpose is to build and help other leaders build caring and high performing organizations. Amit frequently speaks on leadership, entrepreneurship and organizational consciousness at various IITs, other premier institutes and entrepreneurial forums across India on his original content known as “we need to move from ambition to vision” and “six pillars of organizational greatness”. He holds academic degrees from India and Germany in Engineering and an MBA from ESSEC Mannheim Business School with campuses in Germany and France. He is also a certified Culture Transformation practitioner from Barrett Values Center UK and a Yoga and Meditation practitioner from Isha Yoga Center and is a promoter of Conscious Leadership. He is married, has one child, is settled in Gujarat since the last 6 years and has spent 13 years in Germany and Switzerland prior to that.

cards.title: Samit Ghosh
cards.designation: Founder, Ujjivan Small Finance Bank Ltd.

children.value:
Mr. Samit Ghosh is the Non-Executive Director and Chairman of Ujjivan Financial Services. He founded the Company in 2005 and served as its MD & CEO until January 2017.

Ghosh founded Ujjivan in 2005 as a pioneer Microfinance institution for the urban poor. With the approval of the Reserve Bank of India, Mr. Samit Ghosh was designated and took charge as the MD & CEO of Ujjivan Small Finance Bank Limited effective from February 2017 and he retired in November 2019.

Prior to founding Ujjivan, Mr. Samit Ghosh was a career banker with over 30 years of experience in India and overseas, specializing in retail banking. He started his career with Citibank in 1975 and co-pioneered consumer banking in India in 1985. He was part of the management team which launched retail banking with Citibank.

Further, he led the launch of retail banking for Standard Chartered Bank in the Middle East and South Asia, and for HDFC Bank in India. His last assignment was with Bank Muscat as their Chief Executive (India).

He has also served as the President of Microfinance Institutions Network (MFIN) and Chairman of Association of Karnataka Microfinance Institutions (AKMI). Ghosh is also on the Board of Stichting to Promote Women's World Banking (SWWB).

He holds a Master of Business Administration degree from the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania. He is also a Non-Executive Non-Independent Director of Ujjivan Small Finance Bank Limited.

cards.title: Ruchira Chaudhary
cards.designation: Executive Coach and Founder, TrueNorth Consulting

children.value:
An alumna of the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, Ruchira straddles the corporate and academic worlds—-she is a leading executive coach, adjunct faculty at several top tier business schools and runs a boutique consulting firm, TrueNorth Consulting focused on organizational strategy solutions. Ruchira has worked in emerging marketplaces in Asia, the Middle East and North Africa and holds a strong track record in making large-scale change agendas succeed – both from an advisory as well as in-house standpoint.

She uses a unique, multi-pronged approach to ensure change is effective in areas where it is known to be most vulnerable – in the realm of leadership, culture and design.

During her corporate career, Ruchira held leadership roles in Medtronic and AIG in Singapore, Qatar Telecom (now Oredoo) in Qatar and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) in India. Her consulting repertoire spans multinationals, government agencies and leading local businesses across industries.

She was recently facilitated as one of the “21 Women Leaders in 2021” by a leading women’s platform in India.

cards.title: B. S. Nagesh
cards.designation: Founder, TRRAIN; Non-Executive Chairman, Shoppers Stop Limited

children.value: B. S. Nagesh is the Non-Executive Chairman of Shoppers Stop Limited. He has been associated with the company since its inception (1991) and led it to win the “Emerging Market Retailer of the Year” Award at the World Retail Congress in 2008. He is the first Indian and the first Asian to be inducted into the “World Retail Hall of Fame” at the World Retail Congress 2008 in Barcelona.
Nagesh is also the founding Chairman of Retailers Association of India, which is the country’s industry body.

As part of his personal philosophy, Nagesh stepped out of all executive roles at the age of 50, and has set up a not-for-profit entity: Trust for Retailers and Retail Associates of India (www.trrain.org), with a mission of making a difference to the sales associate’s life – both at work and home. In the last five years, TRRAIN has provided livelihood for around 17,000 people with disabilities. Retail Employees Day celebration and TRRAIN Retail Awards have become global events with millions of retail associates participating

cards.title: Vasanthi Srinivasan
cards.designation: Professor, Organizational Behavior & Human Resources Management and Chairperson, Digital Learning, IIM Bangalore

children.value:
At IIM Bangalore, she teaches the core course on Managing People and Performance in Organizations and also offers an elective in Human Resource Management. She has designed and delivered sessions on leadership development and career management on Executive Education programmes.

She was an Indian Council for Cultural Relations Chair Professor for Corporate responsibility at the HHL Graduate School of Management Leipzig, Germany for the period 2012-13 on deputation.

She was also a British Council Visiting Scholar at the International Centre for Corporate Social Responsibility at the Nottingham University Business School.

Her research interests are in the field of Multi-generations in the Workplace, Women in Management and Boards, Ethics Teaching in Business Schools, HRM in Rapid Growth Organizations and Ethics, and CSR in Micro, Small and Mid-sized enterprises.

She has consulted extensively for both Indian and multinational companies in the field of leadership development. She has designed, developed, and delivered programmes to build the leadership pipeline for organizations. She has worked with technology and R&D organizations to build their technical leadership talent.

She has also designed and delivered “Tanmatra: Women in Leadership” – a leadership development programme exclusively for senior women leaders in business in collaboration with Catalyst India and IBM.

cards.title: Shalini Kamath
cards.designation: Founder and CEO, SK & Associates

children.value:
Shalini Kamath is a Certified and practicing CEO & Leadership Coach, focusing on Change and Transformation journeys of individuals and organizations. She also works in the area of Leadership Development and Diversity & Inclusion initiatives across organizations.

Shalini is an Independent Director on the Boards of Borosil Glassworks Ltd. and Graphite India. She is on the Advisory Board of TRAAIN and the Past Chairperson for FICCI – Women on Corporate Boards Mentorship program.

Passionate about Human Resources having led the function at ChevronTexaco, Star, KPMG and Ambit, she also has a deep understanding of Marketing and Corporate Communications having worked in these fields with Raytheon and Ambit.

Shalini began her working career in Zambia and Botswana in Southern Africa with over a decade+ experience in tripartite partnership projects.

An MBA graduate from Edinburgh Business School, UK, trained at Harvard Business School in Change and Transformation, a certified Zenger Folkman facilitator, a sought after speaker, she is a firm believer in continuous renewal to remain relevant in today’s fast changing world.

cards.title: Pratik Pal
cards.designation: CEO, Tata Digital

children.value:
Pratik Pal has been with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) for over 27 years and has held several key positions across multiple business units and industry verticals.

In his most recent role, he was the Global Head of Retail, Travel, Transportation, Hospitality and Consumer Packaged Goods Industry Unit.

Pratik brings strong domain knowledge of consumer-centric businesses to this role combined with a deep understanding of how new digital technologies are disrupting these industries. As the CEO of Tata Digital, Pratik has played a key role in building new platforms of growth.

Pal is a graduate in Electronics and Communication from Jadavpur University and holds a Master’s degree in Computer Science from Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata.

cards.title: Dr. Talam Venkateswara Rao
cards.designation: Chairman, TVRLS, Former Professor, IIMA; Founder & First President NHRDN

children.value:
Dr. T. V. Rao is currently Chairman, TVRLS. He is associated with the Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad for the last 45 years in various capacities, first as a Professor and recently as IIMA Society and Board member. He is Co-founder of the National HRD Network and Academy of HRD.

He initiated the HRD Function and movement in the country along with Udai Pareek in mid-seventies starting with Larsen & Toubro, SBI, BEML and various other organizations. While at IIMA he taught OB, HRD, Social Development & Entrepreneurship, chaired various Programs, and started a Leadership Development methodology similar to what is now known as 360 Degree feedback. Authored over 60 Books (Effective People, HRD Missionary, Nurturing Excellence-IIMA, Managers who Make a Difference, Future of HRD, etc.).

Dr. Rao received many awards including Ravi Matthai Fellow from the AIMS and worked as consultant to UNDP, UNESCO, USAID, Commonwealth Secretariat in various countries.

cards.title: VS Parthasarathy
cards.designation: Vice Chairman, AllCargo; Former Group CFO, Mahindra Group; Coach, Mentor, Entrepreneur

children.value:
V S Parthasarathy (Partha to all) is a leader who relishes his multiple roles straddling industries and geographies as he calls them his stairway to a global mindset. It challenges him to think fast and think new. In his role as a Former Group CFO & Group CIO, Mahindra & Mahindra Limited (M&M), he facilitated Mahindra Group in accomplishing its vision of being amongst the Top 50 most admired brands in the world. He was a member of Mahindra Group’s supervisory board called “Group Executive Board”. As a Board member and an active member of the Risk Management Committee of Tech Mahindra, he also overviewed the cybersecurity strategy of the organization

Starting his career at Modi Xerox as a Management Trainee, he rose to become Associate Director at Xerox, leaving in his wake many achievements. He joined Mahindra & Mahindra in 2000 and completed eventful stints in HR, Finance, M&A, IT, and International Operations before being selected to the prestigious post of CFO of M&M.

Mr. V. S. Parthasarathy holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce and is a fellow member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India. He is a Harvard Alumni of Advanced Management Program – batch 2011. He is also an ACA of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of England and Wales (ICAEW). He is the President of the Bombay Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

He runs for Nanhi Kali (the Girl Child Education) at Mumbai Marathon as a Change Icon and has been adjudged as the Change Legend in Mumbai Marathon 2019 being the highest fund-raiser at that event. He is also an avid reader.

cards.title: Jeby Cherian
cards.designation: Former Managing Partner, IBM Global Business Services, India & South Asia

children.value:
Jeby Cherian was the Vice President and the Managing Partner for IBM Global Business Services (GBS) in India/South Asia. As the leader for GBS, which comprises Strategy & Analytics, Application Management, Consulting, and Systems Integration business, Jeby was responsible for the GBS business growth, client satisfaction and P&L.

Jeby co-founded and sits on the board of Blubirch (www.blubirch.com), a technology start-up working with some of the world's largest online and off line retailers to optimize their reverse supply chain processes from customer returns to liquidation. At Blubirch, Jeby plays the role of COO responsible for demand creation, marketing, international markets and HR. He is also on the Board of Advisors of Zettalabs (www.zettalabs.com), a US based data management and analytics company. He also serves as an independent director on the Board of Tyfone (www.tyfone.com), a US based company focused on digital platforms.

cards.title: Nina Chatrath
cards.designation: Leadership and Business Consultant; Independent Board Director, Oriental Hotels, Dwarikesh Sugars & Vision Springs

children.value:
Nina has spent the last two decades guiding businesses to excellence, through quality and leadership initiatives, as she donned the hat of a trusted advisor to organizations. Her key focus area has been to unlock organizational capabilities using business and behavioral interventions. She focuses on building the strategic momentum of the business by working with the top leaders, which is at the heart of what value an HR leader can bring to the organization.

CEO Development and Succession Planning is a delivery expectation from Boards, as also having a robust process to review CEO’s performance in a way that enhances their leadership and company’s performance. As she works towards unlocking the potential of key leaders through coaching, she witnesses the effect it has on the individual performance leading to organizational excellence.

cards.title: Shri. S. Somanath
cards.designation: Chairman, Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO)

children.value:
Shri. Somanath, a distinguished scientist, is the current chairperson of the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO), the premier space agency of India. He was appointed to this position in January 2022.

Prior to this, he was the director of the Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre. He also held the positions of Director of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre. While he was the Project Director of the GSLV Mk-III Launch Vehicle, their first experimental mission was successfully accomplished in 2014.

Shri. Somanath obtained B. Tech in Mechanical Engineering from TKM College of Engineering, Kollam, and Masters in Aerospace Engineering from Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore. He joined VSSC in 1985 and was a team leader for the Integration of PSLV during the early phases.

He is the recipient of the ‘Space Gold Medal’ from the Astronautical Society of India. He received the ‘Merit Award” and ‘Performance Excellence award’ from ISRO and a ‘Team excellence award’ for GSLV Mk-III development.

He is a Fellow of the Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE), a Fellow of the Aeronautical Society of India (AeSI), Astronautical Society of India (ASI), and a Corresponding Member of the International Academy of Astronautics (IAA). He is in the bureau of the International Astronautical Federation (IAF) and a recipient of the National Aeronautics Prize from the Aeronautical Society of India (ASI).

cards.title: Venkatesh Prasad
cards.designation: Former Indian Cricketer, Cricket Coach, Commentator

children.value:
Venkatesh Prasad (Venky) is a former Indian Cricketer, Cricket Coach, and Commentator who played Tests and ODIs. He made his debut in 1994. He represented India in the 1996 and 1999 World Cups.

He was awarded the CEAT International Cricketer of the year award in 1997, Eklavya Award for sports excellence from the Government of Karnataka State in 1999, Arjuna Award for sports excellence from the Government of India in 2001, Rajyotsava Award for sports excellence from the Government of Karnataka State in 2006 and he was nominated for the Wisden cricketer of the year in 1997.

He has been the bowling coach for Indian Cricket Team from May 2007 till September 2009, he was the head coach for Bangalore Royal Challengers team in the Inaugural year of IPL 2008, bowling coach of KINGS XI Punjab in the IPL 2018, bowling coach for Chennai Super Kings team in the IPL for 2 years 2009 & 2010 and an assistant coach for Royal Challengers Bangalore Team in 2011, 2012 & 2013 Indian Premier League (IPL).

Besides, he has been a Cricket Development officer for Asian Cricket Council for 2 years in 2010 & 2011, head coach of Nangahar Leopards in Afghanistan Premier League 2018, head coach of Karnataka State Ranji Team in 2006 – 2007, head coach for the Uttar Pradesh Cricket Team in the Ranji Trophy for 3 years from 2011 – 2014.

He coached Indian U-19 team for 18 months till the end of World Cup in Sri Lanka 2006, he was appointed as the coach for the U-17 Indian team for the ASIA cup in the year 2004. He has performed the role of a bowling coach at National Cricket Academy (NCA), in different age categories like, U15, U17, U19, U22 and All India University team

Prasad has a post-graduate certificate in International Sports Management (ISM) from the University of London (UoL).

cards.title: Alpana Parida
cards.designation: Co-Founder, Tiivra Ventures

children.value: Having worked with brand consultancy DY Works for over a decade, Alpana Parida has now moved on from the company to start her own 'outfit'. She is the Co-Founder of a start-up called Tiivra Ventures, which specializes in creating designer helmets for two-wheelers. Before donning the hat of a start-up founder, Parida was the Managing Director at DY Works, a leading Business Design firm. She believes that ideas should not have egos, and thus has built a flat and open access organization. Prior to this, she was the CMO and Head of Merchandising for TANISHQ. She has also worked across continents and was the CMO for North America of a natural food brand – giving her a first-hand experience of working across diverse cultures. Parida credits her stint at DY Works for teaching her how to think about a brand comprehensively, from start to finish, the nuances of design, and how it can play a crucial role in habit formation and creating an impression in a customer's mind. Alpana did her PGDM in Marketing from IIM Ahmedabad in 1985, and her first stint in the world of advertising and marketing was with Rediffusion Y&R in 1985. She earned her Bachelor's degree in Economics from St. Stephen's College, Delhi, in 1983.

cards.title: Prakash Rao
cards.designation: Founding Member & Chief Experience Officer, PeopleStrong Technologies Pvt Ltd

children.value: Prakash Rao is a highly accomplished Founding Member and Chief Operating Officer at PeopleStrong, a leading HR solutions company. With an impressive career spanning over two decades in the HR industry, Prakash has played a pivotal role in transforming the digital landscape of HR across Asia. His expertise in finding innovative ways to leverage HR technology to create effective and simple solutions has helped companies achieve their strategic goals and improve their HR processes. As COO, Prakash focuses on delivering innovative and effective HR solutions that help their clients achieve their business goals. He has a deep understanding of the Indian HR industry, and is passionate about leveraging technology to simplify HR processes and make them more efficient.

Prior to his current role, Prakash worked with Mphasis, where he successfully managed staffing for their BPO division. Prakash is a sought-after speaker and thought leader, and he frequently presents at national forums on a range of HR management subjects, including HR shared services, recruitment, HR analytics, and HR technology. He has also published numerous articles in leading HR and Business media, showcasing his insights and experience.

Prakash’s academic background includes a Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, and he has a keen interest in sports, particularly cricket and football. He resides in Gurgaon with his wife and daughter, and he remains dedicated to solving complex customer problems and fostering a culture of customer centricity.

cards.title: Sunil Buch
cards.designation: Co-Founder and CEO, Wellness Niyamas

children.value:
Sunil Buch is a versatile and multi-talented leader. He has over two decades of leadership and general management experience spanning FMCG, Advertising, Telecom, Retail and the Media & Entertainment sectors. He has served and contributed in leadership roles at Colgate — Palmolive, Johnson & Johnson, Leo Burnett, Marico, Reliance Communications and ZEE Entertainment Enterprises Limited where he was the CEO of Zee Live and Zee Talent. In 2017, he crafted one of the most interesting partnerships between Zee & Rally for Rivers, which gave one of the best advertising films for the rally.

Currently, he is the Co-Founder and CEO of Wellness Niyamas, a innovative healthcare start up, and is also Non-Executive Independent Director on Board of Orbit Exports, a listed company. He specializes in creating profitable brand-led businesses via thought leadership, entrepreneurial problem-solving, creative strategy and execution. Happy People make Happy Products & Services and the PAT principle are the two tenets he strongly propagates and believes in. Sunil is a science graduate and MBA from Mumbai University.

cards.title: Ashutosh Pandey
cards.designation: Managing Director & Chief Executive Officer, Mahindra First Choice Wheels

children.value:
Mr. Ashutosh Pandey is the CEO & MD of Mahindra First Choice Wheels.

Previously, he was the CEO of Tata CLiQ (Tata Unistore Limited), the digital commerce venture of the Tata Group, a business that he was responsible for founding and developing in the period October 2014 to May 2018.

Ashutosh has more than two decades of experience in leadership roles across E- commerce and Retail, and functional roles in diverse industries.

He joined the Tata Group in 1998 as a member of its flagship cadre, the Tata Administrative Services (TAS). Over the next sixteen years, Ashutosh took up challenging assignments in Tata Global Beverages (erstwhile Tata Tea), Rallis India, Tata Communications and the Taj Group of Hotels, in functions spanning marketing, strategy, business development and project management. He also worked with Accenture Consulting for a year, where he was responsible for the post-merger integration of two large Companies.

Before taking up his assignment as CEO of Tata Unistore in 2014, he was the COO of Landmark E-Tail Limited, Trent’s online retail business, from 2013 to 2014. He was earlier the COO and Business Head of Landmark, one of India’s leading leisure and entertainment retailers, from 2009 to 2013. During this time, he was responsible for the turnaround in the retail format besides building the brand, customer connect and store operations.

Ashutosh is an MBA from FMS Delhi and holds a BE degree from BIT Sindri. He is based in Mumbai where he lives with his wife Aparna and two lovely daughters, Shriya and Shraddha.

cards.title: Bharat Avalani
cards.designation: Founder and CEO of Connecting the Dots Marketing Consultancy and the Global Partner of Anecdote International

children.value:
Bharat Avalani, based in Kuala Lumpur is a Unilever Veteran who comes with rich global experience and expertise in Brand Management, Media Strategy, Brand Activation, Market Development and Integrated Brand Communications.

He is the Founder and CEO of Connecting the Dots Marketing Consultancy and the Global Partner of Anecdote International, recognized as a world’s leader in the use of storytelling in business. Anecdote’s clear purpose is restoring humanity to the workplace, using story work as its method.

A story teller at heart, he seeks experiences and every journey is a story for him.

cards.title: Amit Anchal
cards.designation: Board Member, Ola Electric

children.value:
Amit is a Board member of Ola Electric and has led Strategy, Corporate Finance and Corporate Development for Ola & Ola Electric for the last couple of years.

He partners with the Founder (Bhavish Aggarwal) in bringing strategic direction to the businesses as well as leads the corporate finance for the group including Equity, Debt fundraising, Capital Market (IPO), Corporate structuring, M&A etc.

Prior to his current role, Amit led similar role for Airtel and Bharti Group Companies.

Amit has always worked with first generation enterprises. Before his current role with Bhavish, he was with Airtel working directly with Sunil Mittal in various roles for 18 years.

Amit has worked with first generation entrepreneurs in building strategy and executing fast growth. In the last 24 months he has worked closely with Bhavish as Ola electric scaled up to be the iconic EV play in India.

Similarly, he has been part of Bharti and Airtel’s phenomenal growth and expansion for close to 18 years.

He has also been a part of several strategic and growth initiatives such as Indus and Infratel Towerco creation, Africa passive infra sale and lease back, IT & Network outsourcing (all Harvard Case studies now).

Amit has been a foremost deal-maker and fund raiser (Private and Capital markets) throughout his career. In Airtel itself he has successfully executed over 70 large transactions of M&A, Fundraising, JV etc. Many of these deals are multi-billion dollar ones.

Amit enjoys very strong relationships with funds across VC, PE and Capital market spectrum and has led fundraising that are largest in the PE space in India.

He has worked on businesses across sectors including Consumer Internet, EV, Fintech, Telecom, Towers, Renewable energy etc.

cards.title: Dhaval Buch
cards.designation: Interim CEO, Bristlecone (Mahindra Group)

children.value:
Dhaval holds interim positions as CEO of Bristlecone and the Group Technology President, Mahindra Group. He is also a Senior Advisor to Blackstone. Prior to this, he has had a three- decade long career with Unilever during which he gathered deep experience in procurement and all aspects of supply chain (planning, manufacturing, logistics and distribution). His last role
in Unilever was as the Chief Procurement Officer for the company and before that, he ran the Supply Chain for Asia/Africa with both roles being based out of Singapore.

He has spent 20+ years in different supply chain roles in Hindustan Unilever, culminating in his running the HUL (and South Asia) Supply Chain from 2005 to 2010.

cards.title: Hema Annamalai
cards.designation: Co-Founder and Vice Chair, Green Collar Agritech Solutions Pvt Ltd.

children.value:
Hema is the Co-Founder and Vice Chairman of Green Collar Agritech Solutions Pvt Ltd, a company that enhances the livelihood of Small and Marginal Farmers (SMF). Green Collar makes customised quality grading systems for all the stakeholders of the agri value chain, by harnessing powerful technologies of AI/ML in crop production and post harvest processing solutions.

Hema was the founder and former CEO of Ampere Vehicles, an early mover that spearheaded India’s E-Vehicles revolution. Ampere has carved a niche for itself as an innovative technology creator in the Indian Electric Vehicle Industry, contributing to environmental sustainability. Ampere has been acquired and Hema has fully exited the venture.

A serial entrepreneur, Hema has spent the last 25 years creating and driving varied entrepreneurial ventures spanning Professional Services, Electronics, Skill Development and Automobiles.

Hema strongly promotes Job Creation and focusses on Women empowerment. She also invests and mentors Innovative disruptive startups from smaller cities that solves societal problems.

Hema is the past chair of TiE ( The Indus Entrepreneurs) Women program, a global initiative of TiE that embrace, engage and empower Women. She was the Former President of TiE Coimbatore. Hema is also the Founder of Uni Connect Pte Ltd, Singapore.

Hema is the Founding Patron of Society for Smart E-Mobility (SSEM), Coimbatore.

Hema holds an MBA from Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology, Australia and a Bachelors degree in Computer Science and Engineering from Government College of Technology, Coimbatore.

cards.title: Anala Padmanabha
cards.designation: Consultant, Director, Mckinsey/UAE

children.value:
Anala Padmanabha, is a leader in the People & Organizational Performance Practice. She delivers growth, innovation, and organizational agility and is an expert on culture change, leadership development, team effectiveness, capability building, and transformation. She also works extensively with clients to drive organizational effectiveness at pivotal moments—such as merger, strategic shift, and crisis—and lead large-scale performance improvement programs integrating strategic, operational, and cultural initiatives.

Anala’s consulting journey began with EY as senior consultant majoring in Mergers and Acquisitions. Being a Chartered Accountant gave her further insights into international business and relations. This exposure took her to work with IDA and other international organizations associated in fostering a healthy culture, Diversity, Inclusion and a holistic growth oriented economy. McKinsey offered Anala a platform to build sustainable human development and performance models along with powering the learning and development engine of many organizations, Governments, Non-Profit Organizations to name a few.

Anala is also the founder director of a real estate Development firm in Benagaluru, which aims at building ESG and sustainable buildings. Featured by the Architectural digest, this award winning firm has projects all over India and aboard, aiming at building sustainable and Environmental friendly projects.

Anala is an active volunteer at Isha Foundation, a trained classical singer, a yoga practitioner and meditator, an avid reader, a certified scuba diver, a teacher and loves spending time with students. She thinks that the future leadership should be that of inclusion and responsible.

cards.title: Gagan Adlakha
cards.designation: Leadership Coach and Senior Partner, Vyaktitva

children.value:
Helping create conscious leaders, leadership teams, and organizations.Gagan is a Leadership Coach and a specialist in the area of Leadership Development and people performance with about 30 years of experience. An XLRI 1990 alumnus, Gagan joined the IT sector in its high growth phase and handled a variety of roles covering the complete gamut of the HR function for about 10 years. He rounded off his corporate experience by handling business roles for the next few years.

Gagan turned entrepreneur in 2004 and joined Vyaktitva as a partner with the desire to help enhance people’s performance across organizations. Gagan has been working on various Coaching, Organizational Design, and Learning & Development assignments focussed on enhancing individual and organizational performance. He has designed and delivered solutions for premier organizations including the Max group, PepsiCo, Amex, Unilever, Colgate, Airtel, Genpact, Tata AIA, Hewitt, Whirlpool, Accenture, Interglobe group, GE, ITC, Hero, RB, Mother Dairy, Ericsson, Cap Gemini, Jubilant, Viacom18, Aditya Birla Group, Godrej, CK Birla Group, Star India, CapitaLand, and IBM. His experience has been across countries, cultures, levels, and industries.

He has also done extensive work with owner/ proprietor/ family-run businesses, partnerships, and volunteers regularly for social sector organizations. In addition, Gagan is currently focusing on areas such as wellness, yoga, holistic living, meditation, mindfulness, and helping develop conscious leaders and organizations.

cards.title: Nandakumar K Nair
cards.designation: Founder and CEO, SunTec Business Solutions

children.value:
Nandakumar K Nair (NK), is the Founder and CEO of SunTec Business Solutions, leaders in revenue management and business assurance solutions. With nearly three-and-a-half decades of experience in the banking, telecom, retail and travel industry, he has shaped customer-centric software platforms and products for pricing and billing across these transaction-intensive verticals. He is credited with building the first automated billing solution for India’s national telecom provider.

He has pioneered and patented the concept of real-time value-chain management in digital business ecosystems and has contributed in evolving the relationship-based pricing philosophy for banking – now acknowledged as the key to balanced pricing dynamics.

A widely read writer, he has written for several technology newsletters and blogs and spoken at various technology and industry thought leadership summits. He is associated with industry forums such as CII, NASSCOM and TiE and is also a keen mentor of start-ups and entrepreneurs.

cards.title: Himanshu Saxena
cards.designation: Founder & CEO, Centre of Strategic Mindset (COSM)

children.value:
Himanshu is the Founder & CEO of Centre of Strategic Mindset (COSM). His mission is to groom strategic minds who can deliver bold business impact. He is a strategist, design thinker and a mindfulness practitioner. He features among world’s Top 100 Executive Coaches in Leadership, Strategy & Culture. He has coached 54 CEOs & 616 Senior Leaders, globally. He has personally impacted the growth of 25000 leaders. In 2022, he was ranked 62nd among world’s Top 200 Voices in Leadership and Top 20 Mentors in the world. In the year 2021, He featured among Top 100 Thought Leaders to inspire. He is currently mentoring many entrepreneurs. Prior to COSM, he has had six careers in his life, starting as an erstwhile Geologist, serving in Indian Military (Retd Colonel), has been an UN Observer in Africa, been an entrepreneur before heading Strategy & Leadership Development at TCS.

He considers himself a STUDENT OF LIFE & A TEACHER OF EXPERIENCE.

cards.title: Annush Ramasamy
cards.designation: President & Managing Director, Sri KumaraGuru Mill Ltd

children.value:
Annush Ramasamy, President & Managing Director of SKG (Sri KumaraGuru Mill Ltd.) is a Mechanical Engineering graduate from PSG College of Technology, Coimbatore, India and additionally holds a Masters degree in Business Administration (Strategy and Manufacturing Management) from RIT, Rochester, NY.

SKG is part of the KG Group, which has its core business in the textiles industry and has also private equity investments in technology, infrastructure and real estate development. The group carries out its social responsibilities largely through the educational and healthcare institutions in its charitable trust.

Annush proactively leads the group by focusing on new product and new business development. He has a passion for new technology and advanced solutions.

His vision for the company is built around empowering the proud employees of the SKG family, providing ample opportunities for the talented and well deserving, and creating a culture for becoming “An Employer of Choice”.

Annush is an active member of the Entrepreneurs Organization, Young Indians, TiE and The Chennai Angels. He has represented these organizations in various national and international forums. He was on the Global Board of the Entrepreneurs Organization where he was the head of GSEA sub-committee. He is currently the NationalVice Chair for the CII’s Young Indians.

During time away from work, he enjoys reading, traveling, listening to classical music (Indian and Western), automobile racing and skydiving. He is also a foodie and loves meeting people.

Annush is happily married to ShriVyshnavi. They are blessed with two daughters, Shambavi and Ananya.

cards.title: Vikramjiet Roy
cards.designation: MD and Regional Head, India, South-East Asia and Pacific, Maccaferri

children.value:
Vikramjiet Roy is the Head of the Region, ISEAP (India, South-East Asia and Pacific) of the Officine Maccaferri Group (headquartered in Italy), a global leader in the niche space of eco-friendly civil and geotechnical engineering solutions for the construction of core physical infrastructure as well as for mitigating geo-hazards. He is also the Managing Director of Maccaferri Environmental Solutions Pvt. Ltd., India. Was awarded for Business Excellence by the Indo-Italian Chamber of Commerce for achieving exponential growth and making a mark for Italian business in India.
He started his entrepreneurial journey in 2002 with his startup, Sargon Geosynthetics Ltd., in the civil and geotechnical engineering space, recognizing early the opportunity and potential of India’s infrastructure development and growth story.

Vikramjiet’s experience of more than 25 years encompasses a range of business sectors like industrial products, civil & geotechnical engineering and core physical infrastructure. He is also an angel investor, nurturing and mentoring IT startups spanning mobile VAS, digital media and marketing tech, education amongst others.

He is a member of the Board of Trustees of Project WHY, an NGO that sets out to create spaces wherein quality educational support is provided to underprivileged children that can improve their learning outcomes. Having graduated from St.Xavier’s College, Kolkata University, he is an Associate Member of the Institute of Cost and Works Accountants of India.

cards.title: Rajesh Dahiya
cards.designation: Founder & CEO, GoodGovern

children.value: Rajesh is the founder & CEO of GoodGovern, a consulting firm specializing in providing advisory services in the areas of Governance Processes and Practices, Sustainability & ESG, Coaching & Culture, Diversity and CSR, determined to significantly alter the way these practices are engineered in corporate India. The firm offers services, solutions and technological products to aid Corporate Governance viz:- Governance Audit, Board Evaluation, Diversity, Sustainability/ESG Strategy, CSR Advisory, Reputation Risk Management, Coaching & Mentoring for Board members & top teams amongst others. Rajesh is Chairman of Axis Trustee Services Ltd and serves on the Board of Max Life Insurance. He is also a trustee of the Axis Bank Foundation. Previously, he has served on the Boards of Axis Finance Limited and Axis PE. Rajesh serves on SES Governance ESG Advisory Board and is also a Member of the CII Climate Change Council. He is on the advisory Council of Buddha Fellowship and the Museum of Solutions, Mumbai. A quintessential General Management professional with over three decades of experience across industries and business functions, he was last Executive Director on the Board of Axis Bank Ltd and responsible for multiple functions viz Corporate Governance, Corporate Affairs, Human Resources, Compliance, Internal Audit, Corporate Real Estate, Company Secretary, Corporate Social Responsibility, Ethics, Sustainability and Legal under the Corporate Centre of the Bank. He was a member of the Large Fraud Committee, CSR Committee, Stakeholder relation Committee of the Board and Chairperson of the Audit Committee, Information Security, Risk Management and Crisis Committee of Executives Before joining Axis Bank, Rajesh spent 20 years at Tata Group across group companies, starting with Rallis India Limited where he handled various responsibilities in Manufacturing, Human Resources, Supply Chain Management, Institutional Sales, and Export functions. He went on to head Tata Administrative Services (TAS) for the Tata Group. He also worked with Tata Global Beverages responsible for integrating various global businesses and products of the company viz. Tata Tea, Himalayan Water, Tetley and others under a common supply chain. Rajesh is married to Hema, a successful homemaker and together they are proud parents to Mallika, Arooshi and Anshul. He devotes his free time to road travels, poetry and collecting music on Vinyl.

cards.title: Sangeeta Prasad
cards.designation: Group CEO, Runwal Developers Limited; Former MD & CEO, Mahindra Lifespace Developers Limited

children.value: Sangeeta is a driven and passionate leader with 30 years of experience and pedigree to manage large businesses through a strategic mindset with operational and execution excellence. She is currently the Group CEO for Runwal, a leading and premier real estate developer in Western India. She believes in creating and enhancing organization and business value and motivate diverse set of people towards a common goal. Her conviction of purpose, tenacity and persistence drives her to do meaningful, value-oriented work. Her experience spans across multiple lines of business, across various functions and roles, handling both mature and startup businesses.

cards.title: Sanjay Rastogi
cards.designation: Head, Corporate HR, Trent Limited

children.value: Sanjay Rastogi is the Head of New Businesses, Strategy, ESG & Leadership for Trent Limited. Prior to his current role he was Head of HR. Sanjay has expertise in successfully integrating long term business strategy, converting opportunity business. Sanja’s orientation and deep expertise of curating people strategy, building customer & employee centric organization with agile culture earned him his current job.Sanjay has recently moved in to his new role wherein he is responsible of incubating new business for Trent in the area of premium fashion space, taking existing businesses to international markets and making Trent operations environmentally sustainable.. Education & Expertise- After completing his Bachelor’s degree in Science from Meerut University, Sanjay went on to complete a course in Computer Application before pursuing his Master’s degree in Business Administration from Mumbai University. Sanjay was part of the healthcare; pharmaceutical sector (Wockhardt Limited) for 13 years prior to joining Trent Limited in 2006. Sanjay’s interest also lies in helping government and non-government bodies in overcoming challenges of employability and education. He loves spending time and coaching students and business start-ups.

cards.title: Shankar Jagannathan
cards.designation: Author; Founder & Former Chief Executive, Cimplyfive Corporate Secretarial Services Pvt Ltd

children.value: A passionate student of Corporate Governance & Sustainability, with three decades plus of experience in Corporate, Start-up, Academics and Social Sector across organisations like Wipro, Azim Premji Foundation, Oxfam India, Indian Institute of Science, Dept Of Management Studies and CimplyFive. Author of two books Corporate Disclosures 1553-2007, The Origin of Business & Financial Reports published by Rutledge and The Wisdom of Ants, A Short History of Economics published by Westland. Prior to April 2023, was the Founder & Chief Executive of CimplyFive Corporate Secretarial Services, the pioneer and leader in Corporate Secretarial automation solution, offering BLISS a SaaS based software, which is now part of Cleartax after it was acquired by them in June 2022. Currently on the boards of a few companies as a non-executive directors and consulting for select companies, Shankar is a Chartered Accountant and a law graduate.

cards.title: Mythily Ramesh
cards.designation: Co-Founder and CEO, NextWealth

children.value: Mythily has more than 30 years of experience in her career. She completed her BE Computer Science from College of Engineering, Guindy and MBA from IIM Ahmedabad. In her 20 year successful stint in Wipro she grew from a Customer support executive to a Senior Vice President. Her career spans product management, marketing, Business Head and Quality. As a certified Black Belt she drove the Six Sigma initiative in Wipro and was successful in moving the organization from 1.7 Sigma to 4.7 Sigma and reducing the order to collection cycle from 365 days + to 120 days. With a passion for entrepreneurship, she was the CEO of a start up in Wipro called 01markets and built a successful business around e-procurement and was a pioneer in Reverse Auctions in India. She is a certified CPM and CPIM specialist. She then moved to the Corporate office to handle Mergers & Acquisitions, Business Development and Innovation. As part of Innovation she seeded multiple new service areas which have grown into 100+ million dollar business for Wipro. In her last stint in Wipro as Senior VP for Wipro BPO, she was responsible for pre-sales and solutioning, product management, transition, platform BPO, BPO Consulting and procurement BPO operations. Her target was to build the business revenue – increase the back-office business from 5% to 35 % which she did in three years timeframe and also brought in 300 million dollars of business for the division. In 2006 and 2007 she was adjudged one of the 25 most Powerful women in India by India Today and Dataquest. In February,2023 she was given the ET-Ascent Business leader of the Year award. She has also been the recipient of the Distinguished Alumni award by College of Engineering Guindy during their 225 years anniversary celebration. In 2010 she and a few ex-Wipro colleagues started a social entrepreneurship firm NextWealth focusing on AI/ML data services, back office and IT services from small towns in a unique distributed delivery model. Their mission is to create 10000 jobs in the small towns. She is currently the Co-Founder and CEO of NextWealth. She serves on the board of Karnataka Bank and is the Chairperson of their IT and Digital committee, and is a member of the Nomination and compensation committee. She is also a Director on the subsidiary of Karnataka bank KBL Services Ltd. She is a member of the Board of Governors of Indian Institute of Management, Udaipur. She is a member of the Nasscom BPM Council and heads a Task Force focusing on moving the IT/BPO industry to set up delivery centres in small towns. She retired as an Independent Director from WEP solutions Ltd and WEP Digital after serving on the board for eight years. She served as a member and as an office bearer of the Steering committee of IIMPACT for eight years, an NGO started by IIMA Alumni focusing on educating the underprivileged girl child in India. She is married with two boys and pursues painting, music and yoga in her free time.

cards.title: Gajendra Chandel
cards.designation: Founder, Viribus Unitis Consulting; Former CHRO, TATA Motors

children.value: Gajendra Chandel is Former President and CHRO, Tata Motors. He joined Tata Motors in 2014, from another Tata Group Company, Tata AutoComp Systems where he was the Group CHRO from 2005 to 2014. At Tata Motors, he led the Reorganisation, Restructuring, and Re-energising Project as part of the Transformation agenda with the responsibility of various strategic growth initiatives of the company. He also pioneered Next-Gen HR and Business practices, seen as trendsetters and industry benchmarks. In pursuit of transformation, he piloted significant initiatives, e.g., building a robust Leadership pipeline, rejuvenated business performance process re-skilling/up-skilling, employee experience and resource productivity, market footprint, customer experience, making the organization agile and lean fighting machine, to be amongst the top global players. Previously, he worked with Siemens in India, Germany, and the USA for almost 13 years where he held various operational and strategic assignments at local, country, and international levels, including the Global Leadership Framework Project. He was honored with the Leader of the Year Award in 1997 by LMI Inc. The USA. Gajendra loves photography, hiking, and reading. It is Gajendra’s dream to create, support, coach, and guide at least a dozen successful entrepreneurs.

cards.title: Kalpana Maniar
cards.designation: Director, Edelweiss Rural & Corporate Services Limited

children.value: A senior professional in the Financial Services industry, Kalpana brings with her over three decades experience in implementing strategic business initiatives though use of technology. She is currently Director on the Board of two Edelweiss Group Companies. Qualified as a Chartered Accountant, Cost Accountant and Securities Law professional, Kalpana was in her recent role, leading the Information Technology function as the President and Group CIO with Edelweiss Financial Services Ltd. During her career, she has worked in a senior capacity with companies such as Bombay Stock Exchange, Iflex Solutions and as an Independent Consultant to leading investment banks and stock broking companies on strategy, technology and business expansion. She has been volunteering with Isha Foundation and other NGOs for over 15 years and devotes her time on various Isha social outreach initiatives. She is involved in the Rally for Rivers project for the revival of Waghadi River in Yavatamal through SPV with the Government of Maharashtra.

cards.title: Deepta Rangarajan
cards.designation: President and Co-Founder, IRIS Business Services Limited

children.value: Deepta is Co-Founder of IRIS Business Services (BSE: IRIS), a global regtech firm with clients in over 40 countries around the world, and a leader in the space of open data standards for financial reporting. Deepta has led and managed some of IRIS’ flagship products and key business lines over the past 30 years. She was part of a core team that drove IRIS’ business pivot from services to products 7 years ago, and is currently sponsoring the fastest growing business line in IRIS. Prior to IRIS, Deepta worked at American Express Bank and CRISIL. A graduate of Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi and Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad, Deepta has been profiled in the bestseller, ‘Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish’, which chronicles the journey of 25 entrepreneurs from IIM Ahmedabad. She was also featured as one of Navi Mumbai’s Power Women. Deepta enjoys reading, singing (and humming) and working with her teams at IRIS to help them in whatever way she can, as they blaze through new challenges in their professional journey each day.

cards.title: D. N. Prasad
cards.designation: People/Culture Strategist and Leadership Coach

children.value: D. N. Prasad – or DNP as he is known as in professional circles – is a transformational HR leader, culture builder, mentor/advisor, program manager, strategist and start-up guy in the HR space! He is also a professional coach who is certified by the International Coach Federation. Most recently, he served as the director and head of Google People Services for APAC and as a leadership coach. Prasad has a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering from Bangalore University and a Post Graduate Diploma in Management (HR) from T.A. Pai Management Institute (TAPMI). His progressive leadership experience spans seven and a half years with Infosys and more than a decade with Google. He has set up several new functions in the market (in India and Singapore), in the region (APAC) and globally, building teams, culture and careers. He serves on the HR Core Advisory Committee for NASSCOM India, the HR advisory team for SPRING, Singapore and on the Board Of Management Studies of T.A. Pai Management Institute, Manipal India.

cards.title: Megha Tata
cards.designation: Chief Executive Officer, Cosmos Maya India Private Limited

children.value: Megha Tata joined Cosmos Maya as Chief Executive Officer on 3rd October 2022 where she will oversee the firm’s operation and lead the animation studio into its next phase of growth. Megha has held leadership roles at organizations such as WB Discovery, BTVI, HBO, Turner International and Star TV. In an illustrious career spanning over 3 decades, Megha has had a consistent record of increasing sales, effective negotiation, profit and loss analysis and strategic implementation of business operations. Ability to overcome obstacles and capture opportunities by closing exclusive deals, create and implement savvy marketing strategies has been her forte. An industry veteran, she leads multiple national as well as international industry forums and an esteemed member of the National Media and Entertainment Committee of FICCI. Megha has been on the board of IBF (Indian Broadcasting Federation). She served as the Vice President of the International Advertising Association (IAA) India Chapter from 2016-2018 and as President of IAA – India Chapter (2020-2022). The second woman to hold that position. Currently she is the Immediate Past President of IAA. Megha has been instrumental in launching several marquee projects in the Indian broadcast space. She has been bestowed with multiple industry accolades during her career. Megha is recognized amongst the top 50 influential women in media, marketing and advertising and was also conferred ‘Women of the decade in media’ by the Women Economic Forum in 2018.She was also adjudged amongst Asia’s Most Inspirational Women in Leadership for 2022 by House of Rose Professional. In addition to being actively involved in industry initiatives, Megha is energized by engaging with young minds through guest lectures at leading educational institutes including IIT, IIM, ISB, UBS, and is passionately involved as a Volunteer with Isha Foundation – a non-profit organization started by Sadhguru.

cards.title: Mohinish Sinha
cards.designation: Partner, Deloitte

children.value: Mohinish has been a consulting partner at Deloitte since 2016. Overall, he brings with him a significant industry experience of around 25 years in organization transformation, cultural transformation, leadership development, preparing mindsets of leaders for adopting digital way of working, top team development, coaching, and setting up learning functions, including bringing in technologies like analytics, robotics and other learning technologies. He is also a leadership coach and has coached and facilitated hundreds of senior and top management executives within India and outside. He is trained in “Action Coaching” and experiential learning methodology of facilitation and curriculum design. He serves as an expert advisor for the global virtual workforce in the Human Capital Institute, USA. He is a part of SHRM India’s panel of subject matter experts on executive coaching and leadership. He has been invited to speak at various HR forums, such as the National HRD Network, and other academic institutions. He is a social media enthusiast, and has hosted webinars as well as web chats around employee engagement and leadership development. He has worked with a variety of clients across industries, in both public and private sector domains. He has a special interest in working with start-ups.
